title: Segment 1: Dido dux et Troianus
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and translations or to score the response.

The student must correctly translate all words in a given segment to receive credit for that segment.

Note: The passage is segmented in such a way as to achieve a balance of easy, medium, and hard segments. Glosses are added to the passage only in order to make a given segment easier, so uncommon words in harder segments will not necessarily be glossed.

Note: The model translation provided below is merely a suggestion of how the passage might accurately be translated. Teachers should use their discretion in accepting alternative translations of any given segment.

Model Translation:

Dido as the leader and the Trojan come to the same cave. Both First Earth and Juno as matron of honor give a sign. The fires and heaven, as a witness to the marriage, flashed, and Nymphs wailed on the highest summit. That first day was the cause of her death and (that first day was the cause) of evil things.
descriptions:
The response does not accurately translate this segment.

Segment 1: Dido dux et Troianus

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • Dido as the leader and the Trojan

  • The leader Dido and the Trojan man

The response accurately translates this segment.

Segment 1: Dido dux et Troianus

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • Dido as the leader and the Trojan

  • The leader Dido and the Trojan man
